content:
No worries about the mistake! I'm glad you were able to revise your response.

It sounds like you have a solid plan in place to maintain your newly organized inbox. Scheduling regular email maintenance sessions, using the "One Touch Rule", and keeping your filters up-to-date will definitely help you stay on top of your emails. Automation tools can also be a huge time-saver and help reduce email clutter.

Remember, maintaining a "Zero Inbox" policy and avoiding using your inbox as a to-do list will take some discipline, but it's worth it in the long run. You'll feel more in control of your emails and reduce the stress that comes with a cluttered inbox.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I'm confident that you'll be able to keep your inbox organized and clutter-free. Congratulations on taking the first steps towards email nirvana!
